p: In Apulia, during the 2017-2018 influenza season, the first two sporadic cases were identified in weeks 38/2017 (A/H3N2) and 45/2017 (B/Yamagata) ( Figure 1). The peak of reported ILIs was reached in week 1/2018, with an incidence of 14.32 cases per 1,000 inhabitants. According to the ECDC Moving Epidemic Method [ 12, 13], the regional incidence returned to the basal level (<2.74 per 1,000 inhabitants) in week 9/2018.
